timeline.bodyText:
why is it not just FlinkResource.get()?
also in MetricsAvailabilityITCase
timeline.author: azagrebin

replies.bodyText: These tests have are in some form or another reliant on the cluster running locally. In the case of this test IIRC it was because the input CSV file exists locally; for the metrics IT case it is because it assumes the JM to be on the local host.
replies.author: zentol

timeline.bodyText: I would put it before the constructor for code style
timeline.author: azagrebin

timeline.bodyText:
is it already expected that there are other types/directions of jar moving?
at this point, it looks that there is only one reasonable way to install things: opt -> lib
timeline.author: azagrebin

replies.bodyText: btw, it is actually a copy operation, not a move
replies.author: azagrebin

replies.bodyText:
The proposed code is indeed over-engineered for current usages, but we will soon have operations from opt -> plugins and lib -> opt, and this approach can handle this easier since it doesn't require additional methods.
I will fix the method not doing a move.
replies.author: zentol

timeline.bodyText: a bit strange that only first match gets copied, if it is a prefix, as a user, I would naturally expect all matches to be copied
timeline.author: azagrebin

replies.bodyText:
The method name implies that only 1 jar will be moved.
Only went with prefix since spelling out the entire jar name is error-prone.
We may actually want to fail here if the prefix matches more than one jar, as it was likely a mistake. In any case, not related to this PR as the current behavior isn't new.
replies.author: zentol

replies.bodyText:
Why not to allow copying of multiple matching files?
If so, I like the idea of failing then and jdocs can be extended to state this
replies.author: azagrebin

timeline.bodyText: at least @param to make it different from get()?
timeline.author: azagrebin

replies.bodyText: wrong place, should be done in the constructor call
replies.author: zentol

replies.bodyText: true, also unmodifiableCollection there, why in builder now?
replies.author: azagrebin

timeline.bodyText:
unused leftover?
although I would go with it for now instead of jarMoveOperations if there are no other use cases for it in foreseeable future
timeline.author: azagrebin

replies.bodyText: indeed leftovers, will remove them. See my above answer for why the jarMoveOperations will stay.
replies.author: zentol

timeline.bodyText: other non-overridden methods can also be package private?
timeline.author: azagrebin

replies.bodyText: This represents the actual API that would be public if it were in another package; will not change it.
replies.author: zentol
